column1: Table LA3b: Key stage 4 average Attainment 8 scores of children who have been looked after continuously for at least twelve months1

column4: Number at the end of Key Stage 4

column1: 1. Children looked after continuously for at least twelve months as at 31 March excluding those children in respite care. Only children who have been matched to key stage 4 data are included. This is the amended version of key stage 4 data. Includes entries and achievements for these pupils in previous academic years.

2. All schools includes state-funded schools (academies, free schools, city technology colleges, further education colleges with provision for 14- to 16-year-olds and state-funded special schools), independent schools, independent special schools, non-maintained special schools, hospital schools and alternative provision (including pupil referral units, AP free schools and AP academies as well as state-funded AP placements in other institutions).

3. Attainment 8 is part of the new secondary accountability system being implemented for all schools from 2016. More information on the calculation of this measure is available in the Progress 8 guidance:
Numbers relating to national or regional totals have been rounded to the nearest 10. Local authority numbers have been rounded to the nearest 5.
Attainment 8 score averages have been rounded to one decimal place.
x = number less than or equal to 5 or Attainment 8 score average based on number less than or equal to 5.
See methodology and quality document for more information on rounding conventions.
